headline: Cabbage Fat-Burning Soup
description: This weight-loss cabbage soup recipe uses tomatoes, bell peppers, carrots, onions, and chopped cabbage to make a filling, fat free, low-calorie soup.

video.description: This healthy soup has a tomato broth and seven kinds of fresh veggies.
video.name: Cabbage Fat-Burning Soup

name: Cabbage Fat-Burning Soup
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can cut green beans, drained
2 (16 ounce) cans whole peeled tomatoes, with liquid
1 (1 ounce) envelope dry onion soup mix

recipeInstructions.text: Place celery, carrots, onions, cabbage, bell peppers, and green beans in a large soup pot.

Add tomato juice, tomatoes, beef broth, and enough water to cover vegetables; add onion soup mix and stir to combine. Bring to a boil over medium heat; reduce heat to low and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I fried the vegetables in oil prior to adding liquid as I think it provides a richer flavour.

We love it! A little flat as far as flavoring… Still very delicious… We added a medium amount of protein and a fair amount of crushed red pepper seeds. Cut down on the celery a bit. It over takes the flavoring of the soup. If we use beef as our protein…. We get the sour cream out…. It tastes like stuffed cabbages. Ditch the canned green beans and go fresh or at least frozen. Chopped asparagus goes nicely in this soup… We split our “tomato juice”… 1/2 low sodium V8 juice and 1/2 Spicy V8 juice. Zucchini is also popular with the family…. This soup and I F…. Pshhhh… I lose weight like crazy and fast.
This soup is excellent! It's easy to make and tastes great. You should try this one even if you do not need to lose weight. I've been making it for years now.

Excellent for a filling meal for a few days when I want quick weight loss. I now sub V8 vs tomato juice, frozen green beans and I use a quality grass fed beef broth. To my bowl I do add a dash of sea salt, cracked black pepper, a few dashes of green tabasco and sprinkle of dried Asian garlic to suit my taste buds before serving. Does not affect weight loss and imo brings flavor up to super delicious!
I use bloody Mary mix instead of tomato juice and also added two pounds of hamburger.

Infinitely too much sodium for me!!!! I'd sub out the juice for the juice from no salt added diced tomatoes and add more tomatoes. I'd skip the broth and onion soup mix and replace with low sodium bone broth. And, because I really do need more protein than 4 gms per serving, I'd add at least 2-3 ounces of chicken per serving. What's nice about this recipe is that you CAN add other vegetables to it, so I'd probably replace the canned green beans with fresh, and add some baby bella mushrooms for both taste and some extra vitamins and minerals, and consider adding more chopped zucchini and maybe eggplant. Mmmmmm.....

I been making variation of this recipe for over 20 years for weightloss. For dieting purposes everything ingredient must be sodium free, can tomatoes must = quantity of broth; and normally prepared with these only cabbage, celery, fresh onion, can tomatoes & broth only. It's not intended to be a vegetable soup. Think fresh, low fat, sugar & salt free ways to flavor.

Very good for weight loss. I would make it as stated then. Ladle about four cups into a sauce pan and add curry one night. Then I would do the same with Italian Seasoning, then Taco, and mix it up. Maybe add a little ground chicken.

This recipe is totally customizable. To make it a more complete meal higher in protein I like to add Pinto or other beans. Fresh herbs are a nice touch as is serving with quinoa, rice or other starch to make your own Buddha bowl. I agree a whole cabbage is too much & the amount of tomato is overwhelming.

Yes, I need to lose the weight but I can't live on just this alone, I need protein. I eat this just because I like it. I just v-8 instead of tomato juice. 1 regular and 1 spicy, it wakes it up a bit. Instead of beef broth I use better than bouillon, as much as I need to flavor it the way I like. This time I tried it with 1/2 green cabbage and 1/2 red. It turns out I like the red better. v8 and red cabbage are also healthier than just tomato juice and green cabbage. An excellent soup. It just needs some real beef in it which I'll try next time. Some protein is also good for weight loss and it will make this soup healthier.

I have high hopes for this soup. Made it today and pretty much stuck to the recipe, but added a few spices for personal preference.I had a big bowl about 5 hours ago and I'm still full! If I weren't testing the weight loss theory, I would add beef and potatoes or barley, and corn!
I wasn't that impressed with this recipe. If I try this again I'll substitute the tomato juice (which is loaded with salt) with no-salt tomato sauce. I would also add some red potatoes too.
Cabbage makes almost every soup better! Not sure canned green beans are okay here -- maybe fresh. Like others, add garlic and some kick. Love that there's no meat!
Very good. Definitely would make it again.
I'm a live alone bachelor and love one pot cooking. This was a GREAT recipe. I only added a garlic clove and a sprinkle of cyanean pepper for a kick. Excellent recipe, love it.

Love this soup Very similar to Italian minestrone I added bay leaf .. oregano .. thyme and butter beans for protein .. plus i halved the ingredients .. Being in australia i had to guess a few of the ingredients Beef stock .. not beef broth Canned tomatoes Passatta not tomatoe juice Still worked tastes delicious
Made this to start my new year off with a few less pounds!! Hope this works!!!

Of course I went a little off the path, but good grief its delicious!! I seem to always add Worcestershire, liquid smoke and some kind of vinegar- they are all low sodium. I didnt have a soup packet so i seasoned with a couple Penzy blends. Many thanks for a great recipe
I love this soup and have made it several times.

I like the recipe , however the nutritional value does not list how much one serving is. It simply states the recipe makes 15 servings, this is very little help unless you want to go through the trouble of measuring out 15 equal parts. I give this recipe one star in that sense.
Added more seasoning

Firstly, it bears repeating what some other reviewers have said, this Cabbage fat-Burning Soup is the basis of a diet plan that's been around for many years. HOWEVER, its the combination of the vegetables as written, that make this work for weight loss. For those of you who have to tell us how you add this or that - "oh, and I've added exercise"..........enough said.
Very good!! I followed the recipe as written. Thank you for sharing!

I added a large head of garlic, half of the cloves sliced, half minced. I also used V8 juice instead of plain tomato. Very tasty, good soup. I would make it again. Instructions should say " huge " pot. This makes alot.
Very easy and tasty without adding extra seasoning. This will make nice, warm lunches next week!

loved this soup I remember making (in back in the day) and when I saw the recipe , I went to the store and bought what I needed and made it the next day. It was just as good or better then I remembered .
Patty
Taste great not sure about the weight thing yet anyone know if I can add sharp cheddar for protein and thickness

Giving it 4 stars cause it was delicious but I did make a few alterations based on taste as it was pretty bland otherwise. I added 1-1/2 pounds of lean ground beef and a whole carton of beef stock (low sodium) instead of just a can. Also added two envelopes of onion soup mix instead of just one, some salt and crushed red pepper flakes. This made so much I had to transfer to my largest pot mid-way. You can also add a second can of green beans easily. Was absolutely delicious! Eating a bowl right now so decided to leave my review! Thanks for this recipe! Delicious!

It's a good recipe been around forever I remember my mom using it in the 80s
It works because u can't eat to much of it to gain weight
She would add alil ground pork
For added protein

I love this soup! I make it fairly regularly or when I get a craving for it. It is heavily tomato based so if you do not like tomatoes, I would take caution. With that said however, my husband isn't a huge tomato fan, but he does enjoy this soup. I don't make any real modifications to it. Sometimes I may swap out the green beans for a kidney bean on other bean just because I may already have it on hand. I also sometimes use V8 instead of pure tomato juice as it adds a little more flavor. Mostly I make it because I just like the soup. The fact that its a diet soup is a bonus when I feel like eating it for that reason. Last note is that this recipe makes a HUGE amount of soup. If I am not sharing with family or friends, or planning to use for a week of dieting, I'll only make a 1/2 recipe.

I love this soup! I used frozen vegetables and added seasonings. I did use fresh cabbage though. That was the only change I made. It has great taste and is so easy to make. It’s great for dinner after work and lunch at work. YUMMY!!!!
Whoa! It makes A LOT!
good stuff

The recipe was excellent, but I recommend cutting the ingredients in half. The ingredients were spilling over my large pot. Either a bigger pot was needed or a smaller quantity of ingredients. I will make it again.

I used leftover turkey from Thanksgiving (oven roasted cajun tony chachere seasoned) also 2 cups of turkey "drippings" from the pan I roasted the turkey in. The final result was exceptional! Remove the bell pepper and green beans, Add diced red potatoes. A few dashes of Worcestershire sauce, A stick of salted butter, Second bag of onion soup mix. Cook an additional 45 minutes for a grand total of 1 hour 30 mintues.
Easy to prepare, very tasty, and very filling. The next time I make it I am going to add some steak burger.

I made this tonight. I doubled the beef broth & doubled the french onion. Ended up with 8 full quarts after I demolished 3 bowls myself. Obviously I'm not looking to lose weight, but it was incredibly easy to make just needed a little pepper and it was delicious. Also put a dollop of sour cream on top. Highly recommended for those chilly winter nights.

I've been making this or a clone for many years. I add some garlic, basil and fresh cracked black pepper. During garden season I may add some chopped Serano pepper and corn. Any vegetable just adds to the flavor. One of my favorite soups.
This should come with a sodium warning. I used low-sodium broth, omitted the bell peppers (I hate em) and onion soup. Also used V-8 in place of tomato juice. Added herbs and spices to my taste.

I have already left my 1 star rating but thought I'd pass this idea along. Since this recipe has So MUCH TOMATO we couldn't eat it, I bagged the leftover soup in small quantities and put it in the freezer. I'm going to use it in soups that call for tomatoes. It will be a way of saving all that time and expense. I hate wasting food.
Great recipe, I've made it several times. The only thing I changed was I added a packet of taco seasoning to spice it up a bit.
It is so good. I make it a lot. Sometimes I add taco seasoning rather than onion soup mix. I have added stew meat or ground beef too.

Use veggie broth with no oil added, skip the onion soup mix, use a tsp or two of miso instead then lastly use fresh green beans. I mean then its a good soup, I'd even add chopped fresh spinach or kale.

I changed this recipe up and I used 3 shallots and only one onion. I only used 6 stalks of celery instead of 10. I used 2 -16oz cans of fire roasted diced tomatoes instead of the whole tomatoes. I also deleted the tomato juice and water and used 2-32oz boxes of reduced sodium beef broth. It had a lot of flavor and I never had to add any spices.
I would highly recommend cutting the whole recipe in half. I know I will next time. I also put everything in my crock pot and set it for 4 hours which worked out fine for me.
No changes. Excellent

I was leary to make this as I am not a cabbage fan. However, after reading many of the reviews felt I should try it. To my surprise, the soup is amazing. I used diced tomatoes instead of whole and added dried minced garlic and dried basil at the ends for more flavor. It makes so much, I gave it to friends and they even loved it cold.
If you want extra kick for flavor, try using V8.
Quite good. I've also used bagged slaw which didn't have any red cabbage - that worked well. Pretty much any leftover veggie works great. Thanks for a good recipe.
I added a package of cauliflower rice and some hot sauce. I used Penzey’s Fox Point and Florida Seasoned Pepper Spices instead of the sodium filled onion soup.

The recipe needs to list the minimum size cooking pot. I started with my 8-quart and had to go bigger to my next size which was a 20-quart canner. It needed to cook longer than 15 minutes for the celery and cabbage to get tender. I would guess 45 minutes. I opted for the V-8 juice. Skipped the dry onion mix and added salt, 2 bay leaves, and a big splash of Worcester Sauce. Tasted good but next time will skip the Worcester as hubby didn't like that flavor in this soup.
Excellent soup but be aware this makes a huge amount of soup so be sure to use a large kettle.
The first time I made this, I thought it was amazing. Due to MY personal taste, the only additions I made afterwards was a few drops of ghost pepper hot sauce and a can of kidney beans.

It works. I’d been on a 6 month journey to lose x amount of weight on a program that pays you to lose weight. You pick amount you want to lose and the amount of time to do it in. I’d been doing great (slow and steady with proper calories/nutrients) but I found time closing in and unfortunately, I’d overreached a bit. I found myself needing to lose 8 pounds in 1-3 weeks. I set my sights on achieving it in 10 days and then I prepared to do this cabbage soup diet for 10 days straight. I shot past my goal. Won my many benjamins and am super grateful for the recipe. But maaaaan, I hope to never have to do this again. If I never see another bowl of cabbage again, it’ll be too soon! It tastes decent enough. But the same food 3x every day for 10 days was tough. Felt like I was on a juice diet. 

Two things that were not listed that I feel would be helpful to others: pot size and serving size. I used a 12 quart stockpot and it came to the very top, so plan to use that size or bigger. Serving size is 355-360 grams for 15 servings if you make attempt to drain juice as you scoop, which is what I did. Will be a lot more if you ladle it on in there for the true “soup” experience. I used quart sized bags for each serving. I put all bags in a huge bowl in the fridge & it was just grab, dump, heat, and eat. Fun times. Anyway, it does work. It’s filling and I didn’t feel weak or fatigued even with regular strength training/ cardio.

Been eating this soup for years. It’s delicious! I normally use spicy V8 instead of tomato juice, but keep everything else the same. If I have zucchini and or mushrooms in the fridge, they go in too. It’s easy to make, the house terrific, and real easy to eat!
I made it and seasoned it with turmeric, cheyenne pepper and black pepper and a dash of seasoned salt. It was great and even got my husband to eat it. I will definitely be making it again.
Love it very filling and tasty super easy to make. I am down 7 pounds. I made a hige pot and ate everynight for dinner.
Gave away several quarts to friends and they loved it.

Oh my gosh! The flavor was so much better than I expected!! I did discover that I do not have a pot large enough for this recipe, even my largest stock pot was too small, so next time I will reduce all ingredients by half.

The cooking time needs to be adjusted here. I had on a low rolling boil & took almost an hour for things to be tender! So healthy but so tasteless. I HAD to add some salt. Then I decided to add shredded chicken & half a bottle of Sambal oelek. That did the trick. Made me gassy, the timing of my mammogram was unfortunate haha
I made this as a recovery food from my three days of bike packing ... This tasted awesome from the break of freeze dried Meals and gas station food...

The directions are lacking in detail. I can’t tell if it needs concentrated content or not. A lot of the measurements are odd amounts or uncommon in the sense most canned food does not quite match the cooking directions. 

It would also be nice if the measures were based on how many cups/weight of celery, cabbage, carrots, etc. I bought the required amounts but while I shopped the sizes varied immensely in everything from fresh vegetables to cans. 

Ultimately, I had to guess if things would work or not. I will wait it out. If it gives results then I’ll up the review from 4 to 5 stars. 

SIDE NOTE: I added half a jalapeño for flavor and a sprinkle of oregano leaves spice.

I make this regularly. Not always with the intent to lose weight, but it's healthy (with the exception of the sodium level, but I can omit some of the salt) and low in calories. I will make a batch and eat this for lunch for about a week. Take a week or two off and make it again.
it's just like veggie soup but no seasoning! so bland! fix rhe recipe to add some seasoning. im going to try some Maggie. hopefully that helps..tried bay leafs. garlic and some oregano. not working.

Some tips and tricks for those looking to meal prep lunches for weight loss. First off- I loved this soup! I made it as it was written. I did add some Crystal hot sauce to individual servings to change it up from time to time. Make sure you use a large stock pot if your going to do the full 15 servings. Once completed I had about 9 quarts of soup (this depends on water added mostly, I just covered all the veggies per the instructions). This is roughly 2.5 cups per serving. If your going to eat only 1 serving a day, you will need to freeze more than half right away as after 5 days it won't be fresh.
It is wonderful! It makes too much for the two of us. We ate it for 3 days. I hope the rest freezes well.

This is a great & tasty recipe “as is”. I prefer more ‘heat’; but others in my family don’t, so no-problem - just added it to individual portions. As with many soups & stews, I most liked it after it had “rested” a few days. All the flavors seemed to pop out much more.
Really good I made it to recipe but added vegan sausage.

I have needed antacids 2-3 times a day and had a exploding rock hard stomach until I started this diet 5 days ago. I don't know what it is but I have NO heartburn and my stomach is not hard anymore. I suppose it must be the cabbage? I need to lose 30 lbs. and have a good start losing 8 already. Try it, you'll like it.

Delicious! I left out the onions and the onion soup as onions trigger migraines for me, but I replaced them with a few more stalks of celery and red and yellow bell peppers. I work in a hospital where I rarely get more than 5-10 minutes for lunch, so I took the suggestion of another reviewer and put a serving of this in my Vitamix along with some bone broth and drink it on the go…. It tastes like a thick V8 smoothie. I’m high-functioning autistic and have a hard time with the texture and taste of veggies but this is a way I can easily add them in my diet.
I Love this receipe, really ez. I did fry the onions and garlic first til they were golden brown. I also add 3 poblano chilies and 2 jalapenos. Plus spices.
Great

Excellent. I wasn't able to find green peppers & I decreased the amount of celery as I didn't have a big enough pot to cook it in. Only other adjustment I would add is more broth to give it a more soup-like consistency.
I love this soup so much! Next time will make less, as it's really a huge batch. Just delicious.

I was hesitant about making this soup when I saw the 2 quarts of tomato juice in the list of ingredients. Even while I was in the grocery store, I thought about bypassing the tomato juice and making the soup without it. Despite this, I went ahead and stuck to the recipe. I decided to make a few modifications. I used vegetable broth instead of beef, increased some of the present ingredients, and added collard greens, green onions, jalapenos, and my favorite salt-free seasonings. I make soups frequently and normally increase the ingredients so the soup will last throughout the week. Upon completion of the soup, I was pleasantly surprised of the outcome with the tomato juice. The soup actually tasted wonderful. I was expecting the tomato juice to be overpowering and it was completely balanced in taste and delicious. I chose this recipe due to the number of reviews and I must add to those positive reviews. I tried to attach my photo, but it was too large. Fantastic Recipe!

I quite liked the soup, but I did add a few things because the final product is a little bland. I ended up adding a good amount of thyme and oregano, some red pepper flakes, and a dash of salt and pepper. I also cheated and added a spoonful of Better Than Bouillon seasoned vegetable base. It was delicious after that. Just a few suggestions if you’re looking to improve the flavor!

I used the recipe as a "guide". I NEVER buy/use tomato juice...my ankles/legs would be the size of oatmeal boxes and my blood pressure would go up significantly. Used a 1# bag of cole slaw mix, cleaned and cut up a handful of fresh green beans and 1 broccoli crown, used a big container of lo-sodium beef broth + water; added 2 bay leaves and a spoon of chopped garlic. As I write this, it's still cooking and when it cooks down....I will taste test and see what I could add to tickle my tongue. Worcestershire sauce? Hot sauce? We'll see....Appreciate the "upstart".

Very bland. I ended up turning it into a purée and canning it. I thought surely this soup would at most be tasty because of how many high reviews it got. I think the reviews are simply because of the weight loss that comes with this extremely low calorie soup. If you are looking for a tasty vegetable soup, this isn’t it, sadly. Will need to modify it on your own.
Good cold evening so used Low sodium V8 juice and full packet of onion soup mix. I can see even adding beef cubes of course that may affect the purpose for weight loss.
This recipe makes a lot. After day 3 I was so sick of it. It's good, standard soup.
The soup turned out very good! Next time I will probably half the recipe as it made a very large amount. I did use frozen beans instead of canned.

This was much better than I expected. I am going out to buy ingredients for another pot today. I think I will not use the whole tomatoes this time though, it shouldn’t make a difference. I added mushrooms since I saw it on another recipe for this, I think it was a good decision. I also used as much organic veggies as I could find. Very tasty and my husband enjoys jazzing it up with a different spice here and there. He lost four lbs in 24 hrs.
This is a great recipe. Every measurement was perfect! Very important to note though that like all the other reviews mentioned, this recipe yields A LOT of soup.
This is pretty tasty. I added a little Tobacco to give it a slight kick. I am looking forward to seeing how well this works.
Very good. Love having it in the fridge for quick lunch or as a side for dinner. Only heating what you eat will help veggies stay perfect and keep soup from going bad very quickly.
Really good! I added leftover Christmas ham!!

Made it for Christmas Eve Dinner. Makes a ton so more than half has gone into the freezer, just waiting for a cold winter night. From Texas so that could be a long wait. Followed the recipe. Got creative by adding some leftover fresh spinach, parsley and low salt beef broth. Served it with a loaf of Artisan Bread from Panera. It was so satisfying, we all needed a nap after eating it. I don't know if it really is fat burning but the carb count is low so it fits into the meal plan we have to do for a Type 2 family member. Just don't add any salt. You get enough from the Onion soup mix and then what occurs naturally in the ingredients.
No green peppers used Goya Saxon seasoning packets and 2 chicken bouillon cubes.
Made just as written. Soooo tasty and warming and comforting! Thank you!

I thought it was delicious. I did read the reviews and added some sauerkraut I felt that helped a little bit. I will say that I'd recommend reducing the Cabbage by a little bit and adding one or two small to medium potatoes to add extra goodness to it.

OMGosh! This is so great! You can do so many things with this! You could add meat and rice and call it unstuffed Golumpki!
You can add and subtract from this recipe. I added more tomato product because that is the way I like it. I left out the carrots and celery...not a fan! I added some Hungarian paprika and some other spices to jazz it up a bit.
I would keep this vegetarian version. You can leave it on the stove for days!

No salt or pepper listed. Had to add a lot of salt. Prep time was a lot longer than stated. Must have been a ninja with the quick time. I added a lb of cubed and browned top round steak for some protein (could have added more). Very good after the s&p added.

First time making soup, and why not make this? Well it is GOOD! Very delicious! I made as printed, with no changes. Oh wait, I added salt and pepper. (& I simmered mine for longer than a half hour). Thank you for this recipe keeper.

I hope I shed some pounds to make this soup worth it. Not good at all. Very very boring. Tomorrow I will add some pepper sauce to help it out. I used a Lyle less juice because of pan soze and left out the green beans. If I loose weight next time I make I’ll had some herbs and garlic or something

I followed the recipe exactly and it filled my largest pot to the very top. I added hot sauce to my serving to give it a bit more flavor. Relatively inexpensive for price per serving and healthy. I’ll probably end up freezing some because it makes so much.
This was absolutely yummy. I didn't change the ingredients at all just cut it in half. This is definitely a keeper.

I added3 small turnips, some very hot Cayenne Pepper & some salt/pepper. I also used 1 box chicken broth & 1 box vegetable broth instead of water. Plus I threw some fresh rosemary sprig & 1 sprig of thyme. It turned out delicious. I made a massive pot of this & it's now in my freezer. I gave it 4 stars because it lacks flavor, but adding the extra herbs really improved it.
Great taste. I omitted the beans because I didn't have them on hand.
This soup makes a lot! It's filling and very tasty. I added garlic for a little extra flavor.
This is almost the exact recipe that was the original Weight Watchers vegetable soup. My mother made it 60 years ago.

I make this alot. Its a great way to use up veggies. I use chicken broth vs beef (just a personal preference). I have never used the onion soup mix before, that was a nice flavor addition and will do this from now on. I also did not use green beans or celery. Instead i used asparagus, chick peas and black beans. I kept the carrots, onions, peppers, tomatoes and cabbage but i did not measure anything just added until i was happy with the amounts. I also had a cucumber that needed to be used so i chopped it up and threw it in the mix. I did not need as much as this recipe called for as it is just me eating it so i made a decent size pot (rather than my large stock pot) and was still able to freeze portions for later.
